description: This posture imitates a dog stretching downward. It rests the heart.
This posture imitates the shampe of a bird. The arms become likelegs to support the body.
Balasana is a counter asana for various asanas and is usually practiced before and after Sirsasana.
The head-balance is called the king of the postures. It develops poise andlightness, and stimulates the brain
This is a easy posture, where the legs are crossed simply. Sukha means happy, this pose is also called Happy Pose
This is a vigorous upward stretch of the trunk.
This is a vigorous posture which fills the body with strentgh.
This is the second warrior pose. The body rises erect over the legs, while the arms reach out to opposite sides.
The tree pose gives a beautiful upward stretch and a sense of balance.
